The Game

In this game you have 12 balls, 11 of them have the same weight and 1 of them has a different weight, it could be heavier or lighter. You have a two plate's scale and your goal is to find which ball has a different weight, and if it is heavier or lighter than the others. You have to find this out with just three weighings.

Playing the game

When the game start the 12 balls are grouped as their possible weight, this can be Heavier, Lighter, Equal or Unknown, like this:
Heavier: 0
Weight:
Lighter: 0
Weight:
Equals: 0
Weight:
Unknown: 12
Weight:
Since there is only one heavier or ligher ball, you need to get 11 balls on the equals group and 1 ball on the ligther or heavier group to win the game. For example if there is 2 balls on Ligher group (Ligther: 2) and 2 balls on heavier group (Heavier: 2), you know that all other balls are defintly equal (Equals: 8), and that the odd ball is in one of the lighter or heavier groups, meaning that there are still 3 balls to be identified as equals. You can drag balls from a active group to one of the balance plates decrasing the balls number from that group, when ready press "Make Weight".

Make Weight

Making weights is how you find the diferent ball and if it is heavier or ligher.

Here is a example how it works:

Lets say there is:
Heavier: 0
Weight:
Lighter: 0
Weight:
Equals: 0
Weight:
Unknown: 12
Weight:

And you drag 4 balls to the balance (Note: you can remove balls from the ballance by clicking on the ball to be removed):

The unkown group will now be displaying the remaing balls (8):

Heavier: 0
Weight:
Lighter: 0
Weight:
Equals: 0
Weight:
Unknown: 8
Weight:


By Pressing , the balls in the balance are weighted the result will be showed in groups as weigth. For example if balls from plate left are heavier than plate right, the result would be:


Heavier: 0
Weight: 2
Lighter: 0
Weight: 2
Equals: 0
Weight: 8
Unknown: 8
Weight: 0


And on the balance it will display the corresponding group colors:

Heavier!

Ligther!



If you are happy with the result you press (when you keep the weight the result takes effect and the balls will be put in the corresponding groups, and this counts as weight) or you can press to try again.

You continue to make weights until you got 11 balls in the equal group and 1 in heavier or lighter. But remenber the optimal solution is always less or equal to 3 weights.

In the previews example when you press keep weight this would be the result:

Heavier: 2
Weight:
Lighter: 2
Weight:
Equals: 8
Weight:
Unknown: 0
Weight:

Dificulty Levels

Dificulty levels are possible cases of the game to prepare you to the last level.
